humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, there are 3 lymph nodes examined, and 2 of them are positive for metastatic carcinoma. This corresponds to the N1 stage based on the AJCC staging system, as per New Rule 12: N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes (No/Total).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for cancer is determined by the presence and extent of cancer spread to nearby lymph nodes. In this report, it is stated that there are 3 lymph nodes examined, and 2 of them are positive for metastatic carcinoma. One of the positive lymph nodes has a metastasis size of 0.9 cm, and the other one has rare clusters of metastatic tumor cells in the peripheral sinus. Therefore, the patient's N stage is N1.
